description: Master the fundamentals of unit testing including assertions, test cases, and the AAA pattern

slides.title: What is Unit Testing?
slides.content:
# Unit Testing Fundamentals ğŸ§ª

Testing the smallest parts of your code in isolation.

## Core Principles

- **Isolation**: Test one thing at a time.
- **Speed**: Should run in milliseconds.
- **Repeatability**: Always returns the same result.
- **Independence**: Tests shouldn't depend on each other.

slides.title: The AAA Pattern
Assertions
slides.content:
# Assertions ğŸ“¢

The "Check" step of your test.

## Common Types

- **Equality**: `expect(a).toBe(b)`
- **Truthiness**: `expect(a).toBeTruthy()`
- **Nullness**: `expect(a).toBeNull()`
- **Exception**: `expect(fn).toThrow()`

> ğŸ’¡ "Keep your assertions simple. One concept per test!"

slides.title: Setup & Teardown
What to Test?
slides.content:
# Selection ğŸ¯

## Focus on:

- **Business Logic**: Calculations, rules.
- **Edge Cases**: Empty inputs, zero, null.
- **Error Handling**: Does it throw when it should?

## Avoid:

- Trivial code (getters/setters).
- Third-party libraries.
- UI layout (use snapshot testing instead).

slides.title: Pure Functions
Mocking Intro
slides.content:
# Test Doubles ğŸ­

When code depends on something complex, replace it.

- **Stub**: Provides hardcoded answers.
- **Mock**: Records how it was called.
- **Fake**: Simplified working version (e.g., in-memory DB).
